meanings.definition: Walk slowly and with heavy steps, typically because of exhaustion or harsh conditions.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she was trudging home in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker was trudging up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The penguin looked like it was trudging through the snow with its heavy feet.
meanings.sent4: The old car was trudging along the road, barely able to move.
meanings.sent5: The students were trudging through the thick mud during their outdoor adventure.

meanings.sent1: The exhausted dog was trudging back to its bed after a long day of playing.
meanings.sent2: She trudged through the airport, dragging her heavy suitcase behind her.
meanings.sent3: The robot trudged around the room, pretending to be tired like a human.
meanings.sent4: The sun was trudging down the sky, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was trudging along the sidewalk, her tiny legs moving slowly.
